result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin M Reed

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Justin M Reed appeared by video.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Justin M Reed.  Attorney Dennis Murphy in court on behalf of Patrick J Anderson for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a plea and sentencing hearing. Defendant is unable to meet Covid-19 protocols. Defense requested adjournment of proceedings. State does not object. Court grants request.  Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 3, 2023 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Justin M Reed in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Theodore OReilly appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Justin M Reed in court with Attorney Theodore OReilly.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Judge Franke. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. 
Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Brenda K.B.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license and insurance.

Defendant Justin M Reed in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Justin M Reed in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge Franke, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).    
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
